intro: Epicharis macrocarpa, commonly known as the giant cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to cacao pods, containing a sweet, creamy pulp. Its botanical features include palmate leaves and a woody stem, making it well adapted to the humid, shaded environments of the rainforest. The species is valued both for its ecological role and its potential in sustainable agriculture.
